segment.source: Provides a checklist to help you ensure that your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is accessible.
segment.target: Provides a checklist to help you ensure that your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is accessible.

segment.source: Here we provide a checklist you can use to ensure that your app is accessible.
segment.target: Here we provide a checklist you can use to ensure that your app is accessible.

segment.source: Set the accessible name (required) and description (optional) for content and interactive UI elements in your app.
segment.target: Set the accessible name (required) and description (optional) for content and interactive UI elements in your app.

segment.source: An accessible name is a short, descriptive text string that a screen reader uses to announce a UI element.
segment.target: An accessible name is a short, descriptive text string that a screen reader uses to announce a UI element.

segment.source: Some UI elements such as TextBlock and TextBox promote their text content as the default accessible name; see Basic accessibility information.
segment.target: Some UI elements such as TextBlock and TextBox promote their text content as the default accessible name; see Basic accessibility information.

segment.source: You should set the accessible name explicitly for images or other controls that do not promote inner text content as an implicit accessible name.
segment.target: You should set the accessible name explicitly for images or other controls that do not promote inner text content as an implicit accessible name.

segment.source: You should use labels for form elements so that the label text can be used as a LabeledBy target in the Microsoft UI Automation model for correlating labels and inputs.
segment.target: You should use labels for form elements so that the label text can be used as a LabeledBy target in the Microsoft UI Automation model for correlating labels and inputs.

segment.source: If you want to provide more UI guidance for users than is typically included in the accessible name, accessible descriptions and tooltips help users understand the UI.
segment.target: If you want to provide more UI guidance for users than is typically included in the accessible name, accessible descriptions and tooltips help users understand the UI.

segment.source: For more info, see Accessible name and Accessible description.
segment.target: For more info, see Accessible name and Accessible description.

segment.source: Implement keyboard accessibility:
segment.target: Implement keyboard accessibility:

segment.source: Visually verify your UI to ensure that the text contrast is adequate, elements render correctly in the high-contrast themes, and colors are used correctly.
segment.target: Visually verify your UI to ensure that the text contrast is adequate, elements render correctly in the high-contrast themes, and colors are used correctly.

segment.source: Use the system display options that adjust the display's dots per inch (dpi) value, and ensure that your app UI scales correctly when the dpi value changes.
segment.target: Use the system display options that adjust the display's dots per inch (dpi) value, and ensure that your app UI scales correctly when the dpi value changes.

segment.source: (Some users change dpi values as an accessibility option, it's available from Ease of Access.)
segment.target: (Some users change dpi values as an accessibility option, it's available from Ease of Access.)

segment.source: Use a color analyzer tool to verify that the visual text contrast ratio is at least 4.5:1.
segment.target: Use a color analyzer tool to verify that the visual text contrast ratio is at least 4.5:1.

segment.source: Switch to a high contrast theme and verify that the UI for your app is readable and usable.
segment.target: Switch to a high contrast theme and verify that the UI for your app is readable and usable.

segment.source: Ensure that your UI doesn’t use color as the only way to convey information.
segment.target: Ensure that your UI doesn’t use color as the only way to convey information.

segment.source: For more info, see High-contrast themes and Accessible text requirements.
segment.target: For more info, see High-contrast themes and Accessible text requirements.

segment.source: Run accessibility tools, address reported issues, and verify the screen reading experience.
segment.target: Run accessibility tools, address reported issues, and verify the screen reading experience.

segment.source: Use tools such as Inspect to verify programmatic access, run diagnostic tools such as AccChecker to discover common errors, and verify the screen reading experience with Narrator.
segment.target: Use tools such as Inspect to verify programmatic access, run diagnostic tools such as AccChecker to discover common errors, and verify the screen reading experience with Narrator.

segment.source: For more info, see Accessibility testing.
segment.target: For more info, see Accessibility testing.

segment.source: Make sure your app manifest settings follow accessibility guidelines.
segment.target: Make sure your app manifest settings follow accessibility guidelines.

segment.source: Declare your app as accessible in the Windows Store.
segment.target: Declare your app as accessible in the Windows Store.

segment.source: If you implemented the baseline accessibility support, declaring your app as accessible in the Windows Store can help reach more customers and get some additional good ratings.
segment.target: If you implemented the baseline accessibility support, declaring your app as accessible in the Windows Store can help reach more customers and get some additional good ratings.

segment.source: For more info, see Accessibility in the Store.
segment.target: For more info, see Accessibility in the Store.
